ryx 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Test correlations

    ryx.Rd

    Test the correlations between the response variable and all the other explanatory variables provided.

    ryx(data, y, x)

    Arguments

    data

    the dataset to test on

    y

    the name of the quantitative response variable (str)

    x

    a vector of names of quantitative explanatory variables. If not provided, then automatically use all the quantitative variables.

    ...

    optional parameters passed to import functions

    Value

    y

    The name of response variable

    x

    A vector of names of explanatory variables

    df

    A dataframe of correlations

    Examples

    # x is missing
ryx(mtcars, 'mpg')
#> Correlations of mpg with
#>  variable      r        p sigif
#>        wt -0.868 1.29e-10   ***
#>       cyl -0.852 6.11e-10   ***
#>      disp -0.848 9.38e-10   ***
#>        hp -0.776 1.79e-07   ***
#>      drat  0.681 1.78e-05   ***
#>        vs  0.664 3.42e-05   ***
#>        am  0.600 2.85e-04   ***
#>      carb -0.551 1.08e-03    **
#>      gear  0.480 5.40e-03    **
#>      qsec  0.419 1.71e-02     *

# give x
ryx(mtcars, 'mpg', c('hp', 'wt'))
#> Correlations of mpg with
#>  variable      r        p sigif
#>        wt -0.868 1.29e-10   ***
#>        hp -0.776 1.79e-07   ***
